headline.main: Answers About Child Health Care in New York

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured.
docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the first set of answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System. This week, Ms. Wessler answered questions about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured. We are no longer taking questions for this feature.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Answers from Judy Wessler, the director of the Commission on the Public's Health System, about health care services for children and young people and about access to care for the uninsured.

headline.print_headline: Waistlines Expand Into a Workplace Issue
headline.main: Waistlines Expand Into a Workplace Issue

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly two-thirds of American adults are overweight or obese, a condition for which employers, in their capacity as health insurance providers, pay heavily.
docs.snippet: Nearly two-thirds of American adults are overweight or obese, a condition for which employers, in their capacity as health insurance providers, pay heavily.
